course_name: Psychosocial Aspects of Occupational Therapy Practice
description: This course builds on the psychiatric & mental health foundations provided in OCTY7825. Content addresses information gathering & service delivery processes in psychosocial fields of adult occupational therapy, including: mental health, physical health, ageing & intellectual disability. A specific focus is on understanding the impact of psychological, social, emotional, & behavioural factors on the individual experience of a diversity of physical & mental health conditions.
prerequisites: OCTY7823, OCTY7825 or OCTY7835, OCTY7829 or OCTY7835
